STOCK.DO_NOT_EXIST_BEFORE_ACCOUNTING_SETUP: Does not exist because the movement of stock was made before the implementation of stock accounting

AGGREGATED_STOCK_CONSUMPTION.DESCRIPTION: The compute Aggregate stock consumption, makes possible to define for a warehouse and for a period the quantity of stock consumed but especially by batch number, while specifying for each product the number of days of out of stock
AGGREGATED_STOCK_CONSUMPTION.TITLE: Compute Aggregate Stock Consumption

STOCK.AT_LEAST_ONE_CHECKED: At least one option must be checked
STOCK.CHOOSE_AGAIN: (Click On This Box to Choose Again)

DASHBOARD.PRODUCTS_AT_RISK_OUT_STOCK: Products at risk of out of stock

STOCK.DECREASE_HELP: Adjust stock by decreasing the quantity of lots of products in stock
STOCK.EMPTY: You do not have any stock in your depot
STOCK.STOCK_OUT_WARNING: Alert : there are {{total}} products out of stock

ERRORS.NO_ROWS: Must have at least one row in the grid.
ERRORS.INVALID_PERIOD: The date set is in the wrong period
ERRORS.INVALID_RANGE: Range error, the start date cannot be greater than the end date
ERRORS.LOT_QUANTITY_OVER_GLOBAL: Total lot quantity is more than the global quantity
ERRORS.MISSING_LOT_UNIT_COST: A non-negative value is required for lot unit cost
ERRORS.OVERCONSUMED_INVENTORIES_DESCRIPTION: {{ text }} with batch number {{ label }}, actually only has {{ quantityAvailable }} {{ unit_type }} consumption of {{ quantity }} {{ unit_type }} will result in a negative inventory quantity
ERRORS.PROBLEMATIC_ADJUSTMENT_DESCRIPTION: Changing the quantity of {{ text }} in lot label {{ label }} from {{ old_quantity }} to {{ quantity }} will result in a negative inventory quantity, The quantity currently in stock is {{ quantityAvailable }}
ERRORS.POORLY_FORMALIZED_DATE_RANGE: Poorly formalized date range: one consumption period must not be contained in another
ERRORS.QUANTITY_CONSUMED_LOWER: Total quantity consumed is lower than the global quantity consumed
ERRORS.QUANTITY_CONSUMED_OVER_GLOBAL: Total quantity consumed is more than the global quantity consumed
ERRORS.QUANTITY_LOST_LOWER: Total quantity lost is lower than the global quantity lost
ERRORS.QUANTITY_LOST_OVER_GLOBAL: Total quantity lost is more than the global quantity lost

STOCK.ENTRY_ADJUSTMENT: Positive adjustment of {{numArticles}} articles into {{depot}} by {{user}} .
STOCK.EXIT_ADJUSTMENT: Negative adjustment of {{numArticles}} articles from {{depot}} by {{user}}.
STOCK.EXIT_AGGREGATE_CONSUMPTION: Aggregate consumption for the depot: {{depot}} in the period: {{period}} by the user: {{user}}
STOCK.EXIT_PATIENT_ADVANCED: Distribution to the patient {{patient}} from depot {{depot}}
STOCK.EXIT_PATIENT_ADVANCED_WITH_INVOICE: Distribution to the patient {{patient}} invoiced by ({{invoice}}) from the depot {{depot}}
STOCK.INCLUDE_ARTICLES_NOT_IN_STOCK_HELP: Shows inventory articles not in stock (with quantity equal to zero)
STOCK.INCREASE_HELP: Adjust stock by increasing the quantity of lots of products in stock

IMPORT.ABOUT_DESCRIPTION: You are about to import the stocks for the following depot
IMPORT.TEMPLATE_FILE_DESCRIPTION: Here is a file template for importing stocks
IMPORT.DESCRIPTION: Please download and then fill in the template file appropriately with your stock information. Then select the completed file via the input box below

STOCK.MONTH_OF_STOCK: Stock Months - Months until Stock Out

MONTHLY_CONSUMPTION.ALGORITHM_DEFAULT_COMMENT: The average monthly consumption is obtained by dividing the quantity consumed during the period by the number of days with stock during the period, and by multiplying the result by 30.5.
MONTHLY_CONSUMPTION.ALGORITHM_MSH_COMMENT: The average consumption is obtained by dividing the quantity consumed during the period by number of months of stock (found by subtracting the number of days of stock outs divided by 30.5 from the number of months in the period). The MSH algorithm is recommended by the Management Sciences for Health organization (https://www.msh.org).
MONTHLY_CONSUMPTION.TITLE: Average Monthly Consumption

STOCK.NO_ENTRY_TYPES: There are no entry types defined for {{text}}.  Add at least one entry type in the Depot Management module.
STOCK.NO_EXIT_TYPES: There are no exit types defined for {{text}}.  Add at least one exit type in the Depot Management module.
STOCK.UNIT_COST_SH_NOTE: This unit cost includes distributed Shipping and Handling costs
STOCK.ANTERIOR_DATE_QUANTITY_MESSAGE: You have chosen a past date. Only the lots available on the chosen date will be visible as well as the quantity on this date
STOCK.STOCK_COST_DESCRIPTION: Monetary values are based on the cost of purchasing inventory, not the selling price
STOCK.STOCK_UNIT_COST_ROUNDED: The unit cost is rounded with two decimals
STOCK.TOGGLE_EXPIRED_STOCK_HELP_TEXT: This will add a filter on lots that are expired.
STOCK.TOGGLE_EXPIRY_RISKS: Show the lots with expiry risks?
STOCK.TOGGLE_EXPIRY_RISKS_HELP_TEXT: This will display the lots at risk, whose average monthly consumption will not allow total consumption before the expiration date.

SETTINGS.DEFAULT_MIN_MONTHS_SECURITY_STOCK: Default minimum number of months of security stock for depots
SETTINGS.DEFAULT_MIN_MONTHS_SECURITY_STOCK_HELP_T: The stock supply should provide at least this many months of stock for the depot involved.
SETTINGS.DEFAULT_PURCHASE_ORDER_INTERVAL_TEXT: Sets the default minimum order interval
SETTINGS.DEFINE_MONTH_AVERAGE_CONSUMPTION: Number of months for calculating the average monthly consumption
SETTINGS.DEFINE_MONTH_AVERAGE_CONSUMPTION_HELP_TE: This determines the number of months (N) in the past to use to estimate the average monthly consumption. The AMC is a 'moving' average, since it uses a window of only the previous N months to determine the average. This setting will set the value of N.
SETTINGS.ENABLE_AUTO_PURCHASE_ORDER_CONFIRMATION_: Enable automatic confirmation of purchase orders
Enable automatic confirmation of purchase orders when they are created without requiring manual confirmation
SETTINGS.ENABLE_AUTO_STOCK_ACCOUNTING_HELP_TEXT: Enabling this feature will write stock movement transactions into the posting journal in automatically. It requires all inventory accounts to be correctly configured.
SETTINGS.ENABLE_STRICT_DEPOT_PERMISSION: Enable permission to view depots in stock registries
SETTINGS.ENABLE_STRICT_DEPOT_PERMISSION_HELP_TEXT: Limit the consultation of stock registries to users according to their depots
SETTINGS.ENABLE_SUPPLIER_CREDIT_ON_STOCK_ENTRY: Enable automatic crediting of supplier on stock entry
SETTINGS.ENABLE_SUPPLIER_CREDIT_ON_STOCK_ENTRY_HE: Automatically adds the transactions to credit the supplier for the value of stock received in a depot when entering stock from a purchase order.  This is only triggered if the automatic stock accounting is set as well.
SETTINGS.ENABLE_CONSIDERATION_EXPIRED_STOCK_OUT: Consider expired stocks as stock out (unusable)
SETTINGS.ENABLE_CONSIDERATION_EXPIRED_STOCK_OUT_H: Activating this option will consider expired stocks as out of stock, and will only consider those that are available and usable.
SETTINGS.ORDER_BY_CREATED_AT: Sort lots movements by their true creation date
SETTINGS.ORDER_BY_CREATED_AT_HELP_TEXT: This option allows you to sort lot movements by their true creation date in the system
SETTINGS.ENABLE_STRICT_DEPOT_DISTRIBUTION: Activate the restriction of distribution depots
SETTINGS.ENABLE_STRICT_DEPOT_DISTRIBUTION_HELP_TE: Limits the depots a user can interact with to the depots that the user has access to. Thus, if a user cannot distribute stock from a depot, they also cannot transfer stock to that depot.
SETTINGS.MIN_PURCHASE_DELAY_HELP_TEXT: Set the minumum amount of expected delay in months for a supplier to deliver medicines after the purchase order is finalised.

LOTS.MERGED_LOTS_AUTOMATICALLY: Automatically merged {{numLots}} lots for {{numInventories}} articles of inventory
LOTS.ENABLE_CORRECTING_LOT_EXPIRATION_DATES: Enable correction of lot expiration dates
LOTS.ENABLE_CORRECTING_LOT_EXPIRATION_DATES_D: Enable correction of the expiration dates for existing lots.
LOTS.ENABLE_FAST_INSERT_DESCRIPTION: This option will automatically select the next blank row's serial/lot number in the entry table. If necessary, it adds a new row. Useful for quickly inserting with a barcode reader
LOTS.RISK_OF_EXPIRATION: There are {{quantity}} {{unit}} at risk of expiration
LOTS.SHOW_ONLY_RISKY_LOTS: Show only inventories with risky lots
LOTS.NO_LOTS_MERGED: No lots were selected to be merged!

LOTS_SCHEDULE.TITLE: Projected Stock Consumption Schedule
LOTS_SCHEDULE.LOT_TOOLTIP: Lot {{label}} should start being used on {{start_date | date}} with {{quantity}} items and end being used on {{end_date | date}}.  The lot expires on {{expiration_date | date}}.
LOTS_SCHEDULE.LOT_TOOLTIP_WASTE: There will be {{quantity_wasted}} expired items left over.
LOTS_SCHEDULE.NO_LOTS_FOUND: No lots found that were not expired or exhausted!
LOTS_SCHEDULE.PROJECTION_BASIS: This projection is based on current average consumption of {{avg_consumption}} {{unit_type}} per month.
LOTS_SCHEDULE.REORDER_STOCK_DATE: Suggested date to reorder stock: {{reorder_date | date}}
LOTS_SCHEDULE.WARNING_ZERO_CMM: WARNING! This stock is not currently being used and will probably all be all wasted when it it expires on {{expiration_date | date}}.

ASSIGN.TITLE: Assignment
ASSIGN.CONFIRM_REMOVE_MSG: Do you really want to remove this stock assignment ?

REQUISITION.ALREADY_USED: The requisition slip has been already used
REQUISITION.CANCELLED: The requisition voucher has been canceled
REQUISITION.CONFIRM_REMOVE_MSG: Are you sure you want to delete this requisition ?
REQUISITION.DOES_REQUISITION_EXIST: Do you have a requisition slip ?
REQUISITION.DOES_REQUISITION_EXIST_HELP: Click on this option if you want to exit stock based on a requisition slip
REQUISITION.NOT_FOR_DEPOT: The requisition slip is not for the selected depot
REQUISITION.NOT_FOR_SERVICE: The requisition slip is not for the selected service
REQUISITION.NOT_FOR_THE_SAME_DEPOT: Exit on a requisition slip can not be made on the same depot
REQUISITION.TITLE: Stock requisition
REQUISITION.VOUCHER_NOT_FOUND: The requisition slip was not found

INVENTORY_ADJUSTMENT.TITLE: Stock Inventory Adjustment
INVENTORY_ADJUSTMENT.DESC: The inventory adjustment module allows you to adjust the quantities in stock of all lots in a depot at once.  Lot quantities will be increased or decreased to match the new quantity specified.
INVENTORY_ADJUSTMENT.NO_CHANGE: You have made no stock adjustments.
